ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I furthered my knowledge of Italian, but I also understand I have a long ways to go before I become fully competent.
Italian grammar and conversation. In L3 we gained a lot of literary skills: reading. writing, learning, and interpreting, as well as many more cultural activities.
I improved upon Italian grammar, speaking, and writing skills that I first learned in the Elementary Italian summer session
Improved italian grammar, increased reading and speaking fluencey!
I actually gained some fluency in Italian.
Italian speaking and writing.
I got a lot better at speaking in Italian.
Learned Italian!

I gained a deeper knowledge of the Italian language and grammatical structures that make it up. A substantial portion of the course was also dedicated to teaching about Italian culture and discussing problems that face both Italy and the United States like immigration.
Overall improvement of Italian reading, writing, and conversation.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The weaknesses of the course would be the 5 days a week. The strengths are about everything else.

This is a great course! It is fun, interactive, facilitates student learning, and you learn A LOT. Not too much work other than the fact you meet every day, which definitely aids in the learning process
Strengths: More speaking, I liked the online workbook exercise which help me to improve my grammar skills Weaknesses: None
Sarah is a wonderful and caring professor! L3 with her is fun! Would have wanted a bit more incentive to study vocabulary.
Its an engaging course, its super fun, the textbook is great. My only problem is that the textbook is WAY too expensive.
Strengths- casual setting, community feeling Weaknesses- none listed
I thought it was run very well.
I think this course was overall very strong. I wish we had spent just slightly more time on the grammatical structures before each of the exams.
Course workload is not overly demanding, exams are spaced well, conversation is encouraged. Even more practice with difficult grammar and vocabulary from ITAL 120 would have been helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I think Italian is a beautiful language and the Italian department is incredible.

YES! The Italian Department at Yale is incredible. They care so much about you, your success, and their language. This course is super fun (especially for someone who hates languages) and super rewarding.

Yes I would because this class helps to reinforce the grammar you learned in L1 and L2 and you get to practice speaking and writing more which is pretty important when trying to acquire mastery of the language .
Yes! Italian is a super fun language and you will get more comfortable speaking it in this course!
You are a fool to not take Italian. It is the best language at Yale.
Yes
Yes, for sure.
Yes! The Italian Department is amazing.
Of course!! I love taking Italian. The department is great and I would recommend it to anyone.
Yes, Italian 130 is an easy and enjoyable class.
